remarks:
A chained inference from transitive law for logical equivalence.  This inference is frequently used to apply a definition to both sides of a logical equivalence.  (Contributed by NM, 3-Jan-1993.)

 A chained inference from transitive law for logical equivalence.  This inference is frequently used to apply a definition to both sides of a logical equivalence.  (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.)
statement:
3bitr4i.1 $e |- ( ph <-> ps ) $.
3bitr4i.2 $e |- ( ch <-> ph ) $.
3bitr4i.3 $e |- ( th <-> ps ) $.
3bitr4i $p |- ( ch <-> th ) $.
